trans-unit.source: Get started with data (Android) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with data (Android) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services to leverage data in your Android app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services to leverage data in your Android app.

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services as a backend datasource for an Android app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services as a backend datasource for an Android app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a new mobile service, download an Eclipse Android project for an app that stores data in memory, integrate the mobile service with the app, and view the changes to data made when running the app.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a new mobile service, download an Eclipse Android project for an app that stores data in memory, integrate the mobile service with the app, and view the changes to data made when running the app.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you create in this tutorial supports the .NET runtime in the Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you create in this tutorial supports the .NET runtime in the Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to use .NET languages and Visual Studio for server-side business logic in the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to use .NET languages and Visual Studio for server-side business logic in the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version](mobile-services-android-get-started-data.md) of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version](mobile-services-android-get-started-data.md) of this topic.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you would like to see the Eclipse version of this tutorial, go to : [Get started with data (Eclipse)].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you would like to see the Eclipse version of this tutorial, go to : [Get started with data (Eclipse)].

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 (Update 3 or a later version).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 (Update 3 or a later version).

trans-unit.source: An Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-dotnet-backend-android-get-started-data%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-dotnet-backend-android-get-started-data%2F).

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Download the service to your local computer
trans-unit.target: Download the service to your local computer

trans-unit.source: Test the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the mobile service

trans-unit.source: Publish the mobile service to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish the mobile service to Azure

trans-unit.source: Download the GetStartedWithData project
trans-unit.target: Download the GetStartedWithData project

trans-unit.source: Get the sample code
trans-unit.target: Get the sample code

trans-unit.source: Verify Android SDK Version
trans-unit.target: Verify Android SDK Version

trans-unit.source: Inspect and run the sample code
trans-unit.target: Inspect and run the sample code

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access

trans-unit.source: Test the app against the published mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against the published mobile service

trans-unit.source: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for back end storage, you can test it against Mobile Services, using either the Android emulator or an Android phone.
trans-unit.target: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for back end storage, you can test it against Mobile Services, using either the Android emulator or an Android phone.

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Run app** to start the project.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Run app** to start the project.

trans-unit.source: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You can restart the app to see that the changes were persisted to the database in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can restart the app to see that the changes were persisted to the database in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can also examine the database using the Azure Management portal: the next two steps do this to view the changes in your database.
trans-unit.target: You can also examine the database using the Azure Management portal: the next two steps do this to view the changes in your database.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, click manage for the database associated with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: In the Management portal execute a query to view the changes made by the Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Your query will be similar to the following query but use your database name instead of `todolist`.
trans-unit.target: Your query will be similar to the following query but use your database name instead of `todolist`.

trans-unit.source: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Android.
trans-unit.target: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Android.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, try one of these other tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Next, try one of these other tutorials:

trans-unit.target: [Get started with authentication]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with push notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with push notifications]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.target: [Mobile Services Android How-to Conceptual Reference](mobile-services-android-how-to-use-client-library.md)

trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with Android.

trans-unit.target: test
